settings.title: What Is Mulberry Silk?
settings.content:
Mulberry silk is one of the highest quality silks you can find worldwide. Made exclusively from silk spun by the silkworms of the Bombyx mori moths which are fed on Mulberry leaves. This unique diet allows them to produce longer individual silk fibres, creating a very refined and uniformed fabric.

Considered the most luxurious silk available worldwide!

settings.title: Benefits Of Silk On Skin
settings.content:
Investing in a Silk Pillowcase won't just add a touch of luxury to your bedroom, it also has MAJOR beauty benefits!

Due to their silky-smooth surface, Silk Pillowcases prevent friction on your skin reducing the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. Silk is also less absorbent than regular pillowcases allowing your skin to retain moisture, preventing dryness and redness, so you wake up looking youthful and fresh!

settings.title: Benefits Of Silk On Hair
settings.content:
Do you struggle with morning bedhead or untameable frizz?

Silk Pillowcases are kind on your hair, the smooth surface reduces static allowing your hairs to glide over the pillow whilst you sleep. This ensures your hair doesn't snag or tangle, and keeps any curls or styling look great for longer.

Silk Pillowcases are a MUST HAVE for anyone with hair prone to breakage or tangling!

settings.title: Naturally Thermo Regulating And Hypo-Allergenic
settings.content:
Pure Mulberry Silk naturally repels mould, fungus, dust mites and allergens, making this pillowcase great for asthma or allergy sufferers.

Silk is also naturally thermo-regulating helping your body stabilise your temperature whilst you're sleeping, making this pillowcase perfect all year round!

settings.title: OEKO-TEX Certified
settings.content: Sleep easy knowing that your pillowcase is free from unwanted and harmful chemicals.

settings.title: Eco-Friendly
settings.content:
Not only are our Silk Pillowcases gentle on your hair and skin, they are also gentle on the Earth too!

Pure Mulberry Silk is a natural fibre which uses less water and energy to produce than other fabrics, making these luxurious pillowcases fully sustainable and also biodegradable.
